messages.title: Dear Electors
messages.content: At the start of this election campaign we were faced with a simple choice: change, or more of the same. But things have moved on. One way or another, the result of this election is going to mean change for Britain. The question is, what kind of change do we want?

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reform the welfare system to combat benefit fraud.
Increase funding for the NHS every year.
Stop unlimited immigration by imposing an annual limit on the number of non-EU economic migrants.
Setting up a proper Border Police Force.
Increase the basic state pension and restore the link to earnings.
Cut the number of MPs by 10%.
Cut Ministers' pay and let people see clearly how the government spends their money.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The tactical situation mentioned is the choice between a hung parliament with years of Gordon Brown as Prime Minister or a decisive Conservative victory.

issues.economy: A hung parliament could mean a huge setback for our economy.
issues.governance: Governance issues include addressing broken promises and the distance between voters' everyday lives and politicians, as well as letting people kick out their MP before an election.
issues.health: Increase funding for the NHS every year.
issues.immigration: Imposing an annual limit on the number of non-EU economic migrants and setting up a proper Border Police Force.
issues.socialWelfare: Tackle benefit fraud and reform the welfare system.

leaflet.personalStatement: I think Britain needs a strong government with the energy, leadership and values to put the country back on its feet and the economy moving. That kind of government, able to take decisive action to start sorting things out, can only come about with a clear election result.

images.caption: David Cameron, Leader of the Conservative Party
